The Oregon Indian Education association introduced and Oregon Governor Brown signed into law Senate Bill 13 tribal history shared history in the 2017 legislative session. Tribal History Shared History is One of the 11 objectives identified in ODE's American Indian Alaska Native State Plan, in which every school district in Oregon implements historically accurate, culturally embedded, place based, contemporary, and developmentally appropriate American Indian curriculum.
